title: why does wukong have the burst of an assassin?
body: I mean. I go and read his abilities. there is nothing crazy about them. his clone does almost no damage. ap scaling. and the rest are not crazy. his passive is tankiness. why does he have this much burst damage? I mean hes up there with kha zix and rengar when it comes to burst. I don't understand it. I mean where is this damage coming from? his ult has a ridiculous scaling I can tell you that they can make it scale with bonus ad instead of total ad. but other than that I don't understand at all. why does a champion with fighter tank status have that much burst is beyond me. and stats show that he does not fall off late game.

1. He has a severe level advantage.

Wukong's burst is nowhere near Kha'zix's or Rengar's, especially late game.

A good portion of his damage comes from the extra effects packed in his abilities. His E gives him an AS steroid, and his Q acts as an AA reset and shreds armor. That combined with Thunderlord's Decree allows Wukong to dish out some damage early.
Wukong can easily sneak in a few extra AAs in his combo and a Tiamat proc if he has the item. None of his abilities (except his ultimate) deal a ton of damage alone. However, he can use them in quick succession and weave AAs between them to increase his damage output in a small time frame.

It is the same reason why Fiora and Riven can deal so much damage early. Their AD ratio and base are actually pretty bad, but they can hit a target for like 3 times per second with all their animation canceling. 
This is also why it feels like that some tanks deal less damage despite having good base on their abilities. Their abilities are a lot slower, and they cannot combo them quickly.

Ok, so we both agree his ult is ridiculous.
So let's ignore the ult:
A very usual combo Wukong players do is E+basic+Q+Ravenous Hydra Active.
Let's calculate the damage:
240+80% AD+100%AD+100%AD+150+10%AD+100%AD=
390+390% AD
Wukong will usually have around 250 AD even building only BC and Ravenous Hydra for offensive items:
390+3.9x250=1365
But we have to consider about 70 armor, even with black cleaver:
1365x100/170=803

That's nearly half of the adc's hp while building rather tanky. And his strength isn't even single target damage. It's AOE dmg.
And this is a simple combo!

To answer your question...because he's built as an assassin.  You do realize he has like four match ups in the top lane where he's not at least at a minor disadvantage or very quickly outscaled.  The only point he's typically stronger is level 1 or level 2, although low elo loves to throw every skill shot at the clone once he has it.  He doesn't have the single target damage of most assassins, and he does have a bit more health, but not enough to be an issue.  Hell his underpowered W is literally countered by a 75 gold ward.  I think his current win rate right now is right at 50% or just under.
